text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service

This transmits new IRM 2.25.20, Integrated Enterprise Portal-Web Services, SharePoint. This IRM will address operational controls, program level controls and technology governance for the Enterprise SharePoint environment.

Users of SharePoint to include IRS staff interfacing with the system in any capacity including administrator (site owner), content author (site member with write permissions), or content consumer (site visitor with read permissions).
Table of Contents
) Shar
oint is used throughout the Service as a collaborative and content agement platform to support and enhance the productivity of IRS staff (employees and contractors). Shar
oint Services provides the IRS Share- Point platform and related capabilities. (
) Purpose: Shar
oint Services maintains operational continuity, enforces provides enterprise-wide governance, and encourages Shar
oint users to adopt Shar
oint best-practices. (
) Audience: Users of Shar

oint to include IRS staff interfacing with the in any capacity including administrator (site owner), content author (site member with write permissions), or content consumer (site visitor with read permissions). (
) Policy Owner: The Director, Information Technology Enterprise Operations EOps) oversees the policies contained herein. (

) Program Owner: IRS Information Technology Enterprise Operations Enterprise Technology Implementation Division (ETID) is responsible for administration, procedures, and updates related to the maintenance and Shar
oint. (
) Primary Stakeholders: Any IRS organization utilizing the Shar
oint in any capacity, should be considered a stakeholder to the related policies procedures. Certain IRS organizations work with Shar

oint Services to support operations and governance of the platform. These stakeholders include, but are not limited to, the following: • Privacy, Governmental, Liaison and Disclosure (PGLD) • User and Network Systems (UNS) • Enterprise Operations (IT-EOps) • Enterprise Life-Cycle Program Management Office (ELC PMO) (
) Program Goals: The goal of Shar
oint Services is to maintain Shar
oint erationally, improve capabilities, provide governance, enforce policy, and support user competency and efficiency with Shar
oint functionality. (
) Shar
oint Services was established to consolidate infrastructure and provide enterprise-wide governance and oversight into Shar
oint ties. (
) All IRS Shar
oint environments are managed exclusively by Shar
oint Services. No Shar
oint servers or Shar
oint Server software will be deployed/installed without prior approval from Shar
oint Services. (
) Shar
oint Site Collections will only be created or deleted after approval Shar
oint Services. (
) Once created, Site Collections are the responsibility of the requesting Unit unless ownership is transferred to another Business Unit. (
) Any request to change, alter, or add to the IRS Shar
oint system ture must be reviewed and approved by Shar
oint Services.

) Shar
oint Services is responsible for implementation, operations, mainte- nance, management, governance, and enhancement of the Shar
oint operating environment including all related hardware, software, and server ﬁguration. • Shar
oint Services is responsible to support best-practices and tional consistency via the performance of various communication and education activities. (
) Individual IRS Business Units are responsible for ensuring that Shar
oint is used in compliance with IRS policy and provide the primary support for their users. • The individual IRS Business Units are responsible to ensure their use the Shar
oint platform complies with all applicable privacy and data protection laws, regulations, and policies. • The individual IRS Business Units are responsible to ensure their use the Shar
oint platform complies with applicable sections of the IRS Internal Revenue Manual (IRM) including, but not limited to, the following: • IRM
, Information Technology Security, Policy and Guidance • IRM
, Information Technology Security, IT Security Roles and sponsibilities • IRM
, Disclosure of Official Information, Designation of Documents (
) The Infrastructure Enterprise Steering Committee (IESC) is the source of funding for Shar
oint and provides high-level governance for the Management program. Review (
) The Enterprise Technology Implementation Division (ETID) is responsible for oversight of Shar
oint activities and reports to the IESC. (
) The Shar
oint Governance Board (SPGB) and the Federal (FED) Advisory Board (CAB) provide additional oversight and direction to Services. (
) Most program-level direction, strategy, and change management decision making authority has been delegated to Shar
oint Services. (
) This program uses multiple sources to establish controls. This IRM one of the controls. Controls (
) The Shar
oint Program Project Management Plan (PMP) (available on Shar
oint Central) is a resource guide used to manage the various Share- Point speciﬁc duties of governance process, operational controls and other tivities at an enterprise level.

(4) The Self-Services Request Processes - Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) specify program-level controls relative to the performance of the follow- ing SharePoint processes: • Site Collection Deployment • Site Collection Deletion • Site Collection Quota Management • Infrastructure Change Requests • Deployment Requests (1) This program has speciﬁc terms and acronyms associated with it. (2) The table lists commonly used terms and their deﬁnitions: Deﬁnitions, and Term Deﬁnition Business Unit A generic term used for any IRS organization (office, division, etc.). Business Unit Representative (BU An IRS organization Point-Of- Rep) Contact (POC) sometimes referenced as a BU SharePoint Contact that interfaces with, and facilitates communications with, SharePoint Services. These resources are interface with SharePoint Services and perform a variety of activities and roles including: Technical POC, Gover- nance Representative, and Self- Services Reviewer. Content Owner An IRS organization speciﬁc resource with site or sub-site managerial responsibilities for content. Includes various respon- sibilities but does not rise to the level of Site Owner. Delegated Business Sponsor IRS personnel responsible for the content and conﬁguration (per- missions, etc.) associated with a SharePoint site collection from a management or non-technical perspective as necessary to satisfy all administrative, manage- rial, or governance obligations.
This program has speciﬁc terms and acronyms associated with it.
2.25.20.1.6 (12-11-2020) Terms, Deﬁnitions, and Acronyms
The table lists commonly used terms and their deﬁnitions:

Term Deﬁnition Business Unit A generic term used for any IRS organization (office, division, etc.). Business Unit Representative (BU An IRS organization Point-Of- Rep) Contact (POC) sometimes referenced as a BU SharePoint Contact that interfaces with, and facilitates communications with, SharePoint Services. These resources are interface with SharePoint Services and perform a variety of activities and roles including: Technical POC, Gover- nance Representative, and Self- Services Reviewer. Content Owner An IRS organization speciﬁc resource with site or sub-site managerial responsibilities for content. Includes various respon- sibilities but does not rise to the level of Site Owner. Delegated Business Sponsor IRS personnel responsible for the content and conﬁguration (per- missions, etc.) associated with a SharePoint site collection from a management or non-technical perspective as necessary to satisfy all administrative, manage- rial, or governance obligations.

Integrated Enterprise Portal - Web Services

2.25 Integrated Enterprise Portal - Web Services Term Deﬁnition Manager (or Site Manager) Any of the various SharePoint roles that includes site or sub-site management or administrative responsibilities. Includes Site Col- lection Sponsor, Site Collection Administrator, and Site Owner. Member (or Site Member) End-user of a site who may read or contribute information (items or documents) to the site. Out-of-the-Box Refers to software or a tool installed within an environment or platform as-is (with minimal con- ﬁguration) and without any customizations or signiﬁcant modiﬁcations. Owner (or Site Owner) Manages a speciﬁc site or sub- site. This individual has similar responsibilities as the Site Collec- tion Administrator but has a more limited scope of responsibility and access. Site Owners ensure that a current SP Privacy Impact As- sessment (PIA) is in place for their site, if needed, and that content on their site is Section 508 compliant. Section 508 Federal law mandating that all electronic and information tech- nology developed, produced, maintained, or used by the federal government be accessible to people with disabilities. SharePoint Analyst Supports SharePoint Services with SharePoint management and administration including user support, communication, process- ing requests for service, and creating documentation (policy, procedures, or best-practices). SharePoint (or Solution) Develops capabilities or solutions Developer within SharePoint using Share- Point Designer (SPD) or custom code. Examples may be custom workﬂows or customizing the master page/page templates.

platform as-is (with minimal con- ﬁguration) and without any customizations or signiﬁcant modiﬁcations. Manages a speciﬁc site or sub- site. This individual has similar responsibilities as the Site Collec- tion Administrator but has a more limited scope of responsibility and access. Site Owners ensure that a current SP Privacy Impact As- sessment (PIA) is in place for their site, if needed, and that content on their site is Section

compliant. Federal law mandating that all electronic and information tech- nology developed, produced, maintained, or used by the federal government be accessible to people with disabilities. Supports Shar

page 5 Term Deﬁnition SharePoint Environment An instance of SharePoint including Development, Test, Disaster Recovery, Production, SP Custom, etc. SharePoint Farm The collection of servers, software, and other components that provide the SharePoint service on an enterprise-level. SharePoint Farm Administrator Maintains, manages, and reports on one or more SharePoint farms. Provides support for any issues with the conﬁguration of SP. SharePoint Platform All environments and components comprising IRS SharePoint. Includes Production, Test, Devel- opment environments. SharePoint, SharePoint compo- nents such as Designer and InfoPath as well as associated third-party add-ons such as Nintex, AvePoint and Quest. Site (also includes sub-sites) Sites are a generic term that refer to any site within the Site Collec- tion. Sites could be top-level sites or sub-sites. Site Collection Site Collections are a grouping of sites and their sub-sites. Site Col- lections provide the core elements to all sites within the collection. Examples of these elements include security, naviga- tion, content types, site and list templates, services, etc. Site Collection Administrator Responsible for all aspects of the Site Collection and manages core elements (e.g. metadata, naviga- tion, permissions, templates, branding) across all-sub-sites. Provides support for any issues with all sub-sites. Site Collection Sponsor The Business Owner of a Site Collection responsible from a non-technical perspective.

6 2.25 Integrated Enterprise Portal - Web Term Deﬁnition Third-Party Tool Administration Includes management of all third- party components and software used as part of the SharePoint platform. This could include user facing tools that facilitate forms or workﬂow development, or Admin- istrator facing tools used to assist in SharePoint management and governance. In these cases, the SharePoint Farm Administrator would typically be an Administra- tor of the third-party tool or component. Visitor (or Site Visitor) End-user of a site who has read- only access to information (items or documents) stored within the site. oint Communications). (
) Shar
oint Governance is a function of Shar
oint Services. This is via interfaces with various governance organizations including the Infrastruc- Technology ture Executive Steering Committee (IESC). (
) Shar
oint Governance organizations and roles are identiﬁed in IRM
, Shar
oint Governance Roles. (
) The primary objective of SP governance is to ensure the Shar
oint is implemented and managed in a manner that follows IRS policy, and regulations. (
) Shar
oint governance includes the various Business Units to ensure that stakeholders’ interests are considered. (
) The speciﬁc duties of governance process are documented in the Program/Project Management Plan (PMP). (
) Local Business Unit Shar
oint governance should not conﬂict with IRS Shar
oint Services Governance policy, procedures, and regulations. IRS Shar
oint Services governance policy has precedence over local policy. policy is the ruling policy for the business unit unless it conﬂicts with IRS Shar
oint Services policy. (
) The mission of this office is to deliver superior, leading-edge, ﬂexible, and effective collaborative solutions that enable IRS staff to solve business Services problems and complete activities. (
) The primary purpose of this office is to perform day-to-day management of IRS Shar

oint platform, including ensuring operational continuity, enforcing policies, providing enterprise-wide governance, performance of all mainte- nance, and oversight of environment change management. The objectives this office are to: • Maintain Shar

oint successful operational up-time and minimize time mitigating risks associated with unavailability of the platform. • Interface with IRS Information Technology stakeholders, as needed, perform maintenance, patching, and infrastructure changes.

oint infrastructure/conﬁguration or the deployment of customizations (including custom server-side code) to the platform. (
) The secondary purpose of this office is to deﬁne, develop, institutionalize, maintain proven guidance for the use of Shar
oint (and related systems). objectives of this office are to: • Identify strategic direction for Shar

oint with consideration of IRS quirements, external process owners, and operational constraints of platform. • Integrate and standardize process and change management activities promote repeatable processes and consistency. • Provide leadership, consultation, and assistance to ensure ing and effective use policy and guidance by all affected (
) Shar
oint Services does not generally perform site collection or other support activities that typically fall to the Site Managers. Exceptions may be made at Shar
oint Services’ discretion. (
) Shar

oint Services provides high-level support to the Business Units via a hierarchical model that involves: • Users elevating concerns or needs to the appropriate Site Owner or Collection Administrator. • Site Owners or Site Collection Administrators escalate questions or concerns to the appropriate Business Unit Representatives. • Business Unit Representatives contact Shar
oint Services for tion of questions as needed. (

oint Central

oint Services supports Privacy, Governmental Liaison and (PGLD) in the conﬁguration of Shar
oint records management services Records functions to support electronic records management per IRM
, Electronic Records. • Shar
oint Services supports PGLD in the conﬁguration of components to maintain the security of electronic records per IRM
, Security of Electronic Records. • Shar
oint Services supports PGLD in the conﬁguration of components to support the retention, and the disposition, of records per IRM
, Retention and Disposition of Electronic Records. (
) Shar
oint Services supports PGLD in the conﬁguration of Shar
oint nents, including records management services, to support Privacy and Information Protection per IRM
, Shared Storage PIAs. • Shar
oint Services supports the creation and submission of Share- Point speciﬁc Privacy Impact Assessments (SP-PIAs) to Privacy, Governmental Liaison and Disclosure (PGLD) per IRM
, and Civil Liberties Impact Assessment (PCLIA). (
) Shar

oint Services supports business units, PGLD, and IT organizations the design and implementation of records management functionality in Point but does not conﬁgure and manage records management schedules including any disposition or retention decisions. • Shar
oint Services is not responsible for performing records ment on behalf of IRS business/operational units or providing management guidance. • Shar
oint Services is responsible for providing expertise on how Shar
oint capabilities and functions may be used to support management objectives. (
) All infrastructure or functional changes made to the IRS Shar
oint ment to support records management must be reviewed and approved by Shar
oint Services.

The SharePoint Services manages the platform’s infrastructure including all hardware, software and components comprising the SharePoint
2.25.20.3.1.1 (12-11-2020) SharePoint Farm Administrator
This role maintains, manages, and reports on one or more SharePoint and provides support for any issues with the conﬁguration of SP.
These activities require elevated rights and permissions on a variety of infra- structure components including, but not limited to, the following:
Shar
oint Farm Administration across all Shar

oint environments (Development, Test, Disaster Recovery, Production, SP Custom, etc.) to include permissions to access and manipulate all aspects of all SP Farms and the site collections contained therein. Database Administration across all supporting databases to include per- missions to access and manipulate all aspects of the databases comprising the SP environment. ) The Delegated Business Sponsor of one or more Shar

oint Site is responsible for the content stored within the site collections and all tions of the site collections from a non-technical perspective as necessary satisfy all administrative, managerial, or governance obligations. (

) Responsible to identify Site Collection Administrators (SCAs) and may rely the assistance or advice of SCAs, and other IT staff, in the implementation all responsibilities including: • Securing sensitive content from dissemination or alteration. • Protecting IRS records from inadvertent removal or deletion. • Maintaining operational compliance with all system mandates. (

) Delegated Business Sponsors shall ensure that personnel within their site lection(s) performing administrative functions (full-control permissions) addition to the other duties they perform, a working knowledge of security and how it can be used to improve and enforce content security records management compliance. (
) Delegated Business Sponsors are not required to be, but typically are, executive or senior-level federal employees. (
) Delegated Business Sponsors shall: • Ensure their site collections are operated according to applicable security standards and Shar

oint best-practices. • Ensure their Site Collection Administrators (SCAs) are properly nated and trained (including FISMA specialized security training). • Ensure their site collections user permissions models are focused on granting permissions via groups and not directly to individuals, direct permissions should be used when the use of groups is not feasible practical. • Grant access to the system with associated rights and privileges, adhering to the principles of least privilege (giving individuals the possible privileges necessary for performance of their duties). • Re-evaluate access privileges periodically and revoke access in a manner upon personnel transfer or termination. • Establish and maintain SP PIAs for any site collection(s) storing, or intended to store, Personally Identiﬁable Information (PII) or But Unclassiﬁed (SBU) data. • Support applicable IRS policies regarding personnel managing, tering, or accessing the system. • Assist in the investigation of various site collection use questions incidents as necessary (site use, permissions, content recovery, • Ensure security parameters are deﬁned according to business need unless system security controls have been established by authorities such as the Federal Government, the Department of Treasury, IRS policy, or Shar

oint Services. • In the case of outsourced systems and services, ensure the and applicable security requirements and controls are integrated into procurement (or other contract or service provisioning) vehicle. • Ensure the site collection certiﬁcation requirements (PII/SBU, sions, Audit Log) are maintained.

) The PII/SBU compliance status of a site collection must be reviewed and certiﬁed periodically by the Site Collection Administrators, per the IRS Site Management Guide in accordance with PGLD requirements. (
) Failure of the Business Unit and Site Collection Administrators to certify by deadline could lead to the site being disabled or removed at the discretion Shar
oint Services and/or PGLD. (

oint or Test environments. (
) Permissions should be assigned via Shar

oint Groups. Direct should be used when the use of groups is not feasible or practical situations when item level permissions are used as part of an automated Permissions best-practices are discussed within the IRS Site Management Guide. (
) Site Collection permissions must be reviewed and certiﬁed periodically by Site Collection Administrators, per the IRS Site Management Guide to guidelines determined by Shar
oint Services, approved policies, or any applicable IRMs. (
) Failure to certify by the deadline could lead to the Site Collection being disabled or removed at the discretion of Shar
oint Services and/or curity. (
) Site Collection Administrators and Owners are discouraged from making changes to the base SP Permissions model including customizations to the Out-of-the-Box (OOB) permission levels. (
) All infrastructure changes made to IRS Shar
oint to support permissions management are reviewed and approved by Shar
oint Services.

(12-11-2020) Customization and Conﬁguration of SharePoint
SharePoint Services has established a set of practices and procedures that must be followed in performing customization activities.
Integrated Enterprise Portal - Web Services
• Proposed server-deployed code should be vetted by Shar
oint Services prior to analysis and development. • To submit a proposed concept for consideration SP users will create an entry on the Shar
oint Registry. (
) Server-deployed custom code shall be developed consistent with the IRS Shar
oint Development Standard available on Shar
oint Central. (
) All server-deployed custom code developed by business units with the intention of deployment to the IRS Shar
oint environment shall be developed in accordance to IRS Enterprise Life-Cycle (ELC) methodology (and documen- tation requirements). (
) Shar
oint Services must approve all proposals for server-deployed custom code prior to development (via the Shar
oint Change Control Board (SP CCB)).
Server-deployed custom code shall be developed consistent with the IRS SharePoint Development Standard available on SharePoint Central.
